R A D I U S

The purpose of this library is to enable all developers to use the design guidelines set by the Funding Circle design team. With that in mind, we’ve built this documentation so that it’s easy for anyone to use a collection of variables, mixins, functions and utility classes.

Built with Sass

The library is built in Sass, with a strong accent on components. The naming methodologies used are BEM and OOCSS (utility classes).

Device agnostic

Everything is built with a device agnostic approach. We encourage the developers to use the mixins and functions provided to personalise their UX.

Pre-built customisable components

We’ve already built components for you to use. You can have out of the box tabs, custom form elements, hero/billboards and many more.

Requirements

  • NodeJS
  • npm

How to use

You can easily import this repository into your project using bower. Just amend `devDependencies` of your project’s bower configuration file with:

"devDependencies": { "radius" : "git@github.com:FundingCircle/radius.git#1.0.0" }

Import the library

Import the `style.scss` file from the `dist` directory of the project.
